vulnerabilities.name: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: User input concatenated directly into SQL queries without sanitization
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor database logs for queries containing SQL metacharacters (', --, UNION, OR 1=1); track abnormal query patterns or failed authentication bypasses; log queries returning unexpected row counts

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) - Reflected
vulnerabilities.description: User input echoed back to page without HTML encoding
vulnerabilities.detection: Log inputs containing <script>, onerror=, javascript:, or other script-related strings; monitor for requests to honeypot endpoints embedded in XSS payloads; track Content-Security-Policy violations

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) - Stored
vulnerabilities.description: Malicious scripts saved to database and displayed to other users
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan database entries for script tags or JavaScript; monitor for sudden spikes in page load errors; track users viewing content that triggers CSP violations

vulnerabilities.name: Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR)
vulnerabilities.description: Sequential or guessable IDs expose unauthorized resources
vulnerabilities.detection: Track users accessing resource IDs outside their normal range; monitor rapid sequential ID requests; log access to honeypot resources with attractive IDs

vulnerabilities.name: Broken Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Missing or weak session management
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for session tokens being reused across different IPs; track login success without proper credentials; log access after session should have expired

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Access Control
vulnerabilities.description: No authorization checks on sensitive endpoints
vulnerabilities.detection: Log direct URL access to admin pages without prior authentication; track users accessing endpoints above their privilege level; monitor referrer headers for missing navigation flows

mitre_attack.tactic: Defense Evasion, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, Initial Access

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive actions lack anti-CSRF tokens
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor POST requests with external referrer headers; track identical requests from multiple IPs; log state-changing actions without CSRF tokens

vulnerabilities.name: Sensitive Data Exposure - Client Side
vulnerabilities.description: API keys or secrets visible in JavaScript/HTML
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for requests using honeypot API keys embedded in code; track access attempts to fake credentials; log DevTools opening events

vulnerabilities.name: XML External Entity (XXE)
vulnerabilities.description: XML parser processes external entity references
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for file access attempts to /etc/passwd or C:\windows\win.ini; track unusual outbound connections during XML processing; log XML inputs containing <!ENTITY or SYSTEM keywords

vulnerabilities.name: Insecure Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: Untrusted data deserialized without validation
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for serialized objects in cookies or parameters; track unexpected code execution or file creation; log deserialization errors or type mismatches

vulnerabilities.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
vulnerabilities.description: Application fetches user-supplied URLs without validation
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor requests to internal IP ranges (127.0.0.1, 192.168.x.x, 169.254.x.x); track access to cloud metadata endpoints (169.254.169.254); log failed internal service connections

vulnerabilities.name: Path Traversal
vulnerabilities.description: File paths constructed from user input allow directory navigation
vulnerabilities.detection: Log file access requests containing ../, ..\, or absolute paths; monitor reads of sensitive files (/etc/passwd, web.config); track access attempts to honeypot files in parent directories

vulnerabilities.name: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
vulnerabilities.description: Application includes files based on unvalidated user input
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor includes containing ../ or absolute paths; track access to system files through file parameter; log unusual file extensions in include parameters

vulnerabilities.name: Remote File Inclusion (RFI)
vulnerabilities.description: Application includes files from remote URLs
vulnerabilities.detection: Track include parameters containing http://, ftp://, or external domains; monitor outbound connections during page rendering; log includes from suspicious domains

vulnerabilities.name: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: User input passed to system shell commands
vulnerabilities.detection: Log inputs containing shell metacharacters (;, |, &, $, `, ||, &&); monitor unexpected child processes; track file system changes or network connections during request processing

vulnerabilities.name: LDAP Injection
vulnerabilities.description: User input in LDAP queries without sanitization
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor LDAP queries containing *, ), (, |, &; track successful authentication with malformed usernames; log access to unexpected directory entries

vulnerabilities.name: Row Level Security Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: Multi-tenant data accessed without tenant filtering
vulnerabilities.detection: Track users accessing records from multiple tenant IDs; monitor queries missing tenant filters; log access to honeypot records from other organizations

vulnerabilities.name: Mass Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: Bulk property updates without field whitelisting
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for unexpected parameter names (isAdmin, role, permissions); track privilege escalations; log updates to protected fields

vulnerabilities.name: Insufficient Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: No throttling on sensitive endpoints
vulnerabilities.detection: Track requests per user/IP exceeding normal thresholds; monitor rapid-fire login attempts; log brute force patterns

vulnerabilities.name: Open Redirect
vulnerabilities.description: Redirect URLs taken from unvalidated user input
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor redirect parameters containing external domains; track redirects to known phishing sites; log redirects outside your domain

vulnerabilities.name: Clickjacking
vulnerabilities.description: Missing X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors headers
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for your pages loaded in iframes from external domains; track unexpected referrers; use JavaScript to detect frame embedding attempts

vulnerabilities.name: Weak Password Policy
vulnerabilities.description: No complexity or length requirements
vulnerabilities.detection: Log passwords matching common weak password lists; track accounts created with short passwords; monitor password reuse across accounts

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Security Headers
vulnerabilities.description: Absent HSTS, CSP, X-Content-Type-Options headers
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for mixed content errors; track protocol downgrade attempts; log browsers connecting without HSTS

vulnerabilities.name: Insecure File Upload
vulnerabilities.description: No validation of uploaded file types or content
vulnerabilities.detection: Track uploads with executable extensions (.php, .jsp, .exe); monitor file uploads to web-accessible directories; log suspicious MIME types

vulnerabilities.name: Directory Listing Enabled
vulnerabilities.description: Web server shows directory contents
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor access to directories without index files; track requests returning 200 with directory listings; log honeypot directory accesses

vulnerabilities.name: Information Disclosure in Errors
vulnerabilities.description: Verbose error messages reveal stack traces or database details
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor for error pages containing SQL errors, file paths, or stack traces; track 500 errors visible to users; log debug mode enabled in production

vulnerabilities.name: Unvalidated Redirects in Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Login redirect parameter exploited for phishing
vulnerabilities.detection: Track redirect parameters in login requests; monitor post-authentication redirects to external domains; log suspicious redirect patterns

vulnerabilities.name: Cookie Security Issues
vulnerabilities.description: Missing Secure, HttpOnly, or SameSite flags
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor cookies transmitted over HTTP; track cookies accessible via JavaScript when they shouldn't be; log cross-site cookie usage

vulnerabilities.name: API Key in URL Parameters
vulnerabilities.description: Authentication credentials passed in GET requests
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan access logs for API keys in URLs; monitor for keys appearing in browser history or referrer headers; track key reuse across IPs

vulnerabilities.name: NoSQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Unvalidated input in NoSQL queries (MongoDB, etc.)
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor queries containing $where, $ne, $gt operators from user input; track authentication bypasses using operator injection; log unusual query patterns or regex injections

vulnerabilities.name: HTTPS Not Enabled
vulnerabilities.description: Website served over HTTP instead of HTTPS
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor connections on port 80; track HTTP requests without redirection to HTTPS; log unencrypted traffic

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Content Security Policy (CSP)
vulnerabilities.description: No Content-Security-Policy header to prevent XSS and injection attacks
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing Content-Security-Policy; monitor XSS attempts that would be blocked by CSP; track inline script execution

vulnerabilities.name: Certificate Expiry
vulnerabilities.description: TLS/SSL certificate is expired or expiring soon
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor certificate expiration dates; track certificate validity periods; log certificates expiring within 30 days; alert on expired certificates

vulnerabilities.name: Mixed Content
vulnerabilities.description: HTTPS page loading HTTP resources (scripts, images, stylesheets)
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor browser console for mixed content warnings; track HTTP resources loaded on HTTPS pages; log insecure resource requests

vulnerabilities.name: Outdated TLS Version
vulnerabilities.description: Server supports only TLS 1.0 or 1.1 instead of TLS 1.2+
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan TLS handshakes for protocol version; monitor connections using TLS 1.0/1.1; track cipher suite negotiations; log outdated protocol usage

vulnerabilities.name: Deprecated TLS Support
vulnerabilities.description: Server still supports deprecated SSL 2.0/3.0 or TLS 1.0
vulnerabilities.detection: Test for SSL 2.0/3.0 and TLS 1.0 support; monitor deprecated protocol handshakes; log clients using obsolete protocols

vulnerabilities.name: Weak Cipher Suite
vulnerabilities.description: Server supports weak or export-grade cipher suites
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan supported cipher suites; monitor for NULL, EXPORT, DES, RC4, or MD5-based ciphers; track weak cipher negotiations; log cipher suite usage

vulnerabilities.name: Missing HSTS Header
vulnerabilities.description: HTTP Strict-Transport-Security header not set
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing Strict-Transport-Security; monitor HTTP connections that should be HTTPS; track protocol downgrade attempts

vulnerabilities.name: Missing X-Frame-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: X-Frame-Options header not set, allowing clickjacking
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing X-Frame-Options; monitor pages loaded in iframes from external domains; track frame embedding attempts

vulnerabilities.name: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header
vulnerabilities.description: X-Content-Type-Options header not set to 'nosniff'
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing X-Content-Type-Options; monitor MIME-type sniffing behavior; track content-type mismatches

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Permissions-Policy Header
vulnerabilities.description: Permissions-Policy (formerly Feature-Policy) header not set
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing Permissions-Policy; monitor access to browser features (camera, microphone, geolocation); track feature usage patterns

vulnerabilities.name: Insecure Set-Cookie Headers
vulnerabilities.description: Cookies set without Secure, HttpOnly, or SameSite attributes
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan Set-Cookie headers for missing security flags; monitor cookies sent over HTTP; track cookies accessible via JavaScript; log cross-site cookie transmission

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Referrer Policy
vulnerabilities.description: Referrer-Policy header not set or set to unsafe value
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing or weak Referrer-Policy; monitor referrer information leakage; track sensitive URLs in referrer headers

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Content-Type Header
vulnerabilities.description: Content-Type header not set or incorrectly configured
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing Content-Type; monitor MIME-type mismatches; track content served with incorrect types; log browser interpretation errors

vulnerabilities.name: Lack of Trusted Types Readiness
vulnerabilities.description: Application not prepared for Trusted Types enforcement
vulnerabilities.detection: Monitor DOM-based XSS vulnerabilities; track usage of dangerous DOM sinks (innerHTML, eval); scan for CSP with require-trusted-types-for directive

vulnerabilities.name: Missing Cross-Origin Resource Isolation
vulnerabilities.description: Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy and Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy headers not set
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan HTTP response headers for missing COEP and COOP; monitor cross-origin resource access; track Spectre-related timing attacks; log SharedArrayBuffer usage

vulnerabilities.name: Server Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Server header reveals server type and version information
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan Server header in HTTP responses; monitor for detailed version information (Apache/2.4.41, nginx/1.18.0); track banner information in responses

vulnerabilities.name: Deprecated X-XSS-Protection Header
vulnerabilities.description: Using deprecated X-XSS-Protection header instead of CSP
vulnerabilities.detection: Scan for presence of X-XSS-Protection header; monitor for reliance on browser XSS filters; check for missing modern CSP implementation
